    Check for gene-cancer associations in database

    checkGeneCancerAssociations.Rd

    Internal function that checks for all gene-cancer associations in a database, based on the net penetrances at age 50. The user can optionally restrict the sexes and races to consider. The function will either plot the resulting matrix of associations or return it.

    checkGeneCancerAssociations(
  db = NULL,
  isPlot = TRUE,
  Race = NULL,
  Sex = NULL,
  shading_color = "dimgray"
)

    Arguments

    db

    A model-specific database returned by buildDatabase. The default is NULL, in which case a database of all currently-supported genes and cancers in the package will be used.

    isPlot

    A boolean flag indicating whether or not the function should plot the matrix of gene-cancer associations. The default is TRUE. If FALSE, the plot will be suppressed and the matrix will be returned.

    Race

    A character vector of races to consider when checking for associations. The default is NULL, in which case all races in db will be considered when checking for gene-cancer associations.

    Sex

    A character vector of sexes to consider when checking for associations. The default is NULL, in which case all sexes in db will be considered when checking for gene-cancer associations.

    shading_color

    The color to use for shading in gene-cancer associations when isPlot is TRUE. The default is "dimgray".

    Value

    If isPlot is TRUE, the function will return a plot. If isPlot is FALSE, a boolean matrix with rows corresponding to the cancers in db and the columns corresponding to the genes in db. Associations that exist in db are TRUE in the matrix.

    Examples

    # Plot all gene-cancer associations in PanelPRODatabase
# Not run
# PanelPRO:::checkGeneCancerAssociations()

    Contents
